definition: to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment
vice-chairman (of an organization)/vice president (of a company)/deputy governor (of a bank)
to cut staff/to lay off employees
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach

sentences.english: China fends off Obama pressure over North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬要求中國製裁朝鮮遭到拒絕。

sentences.english: Cut the interfacings and underlining and tack them to the wrong side of the sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 裁襯布和襯裏並粗縫到袖了的反面。

sentences.english: Blanking gap has great effect on the blanking procedure.
sentences.chinese: 衝裁間隙對沖裁過程有着很大的影響。

sentences.english: Figured out all the maths and cut a piece of buckram the right size.
sentences.chinese: 發揮一下數學天分吧，裁一條大小合適的紙帶來。

sentences.english: Because of budget constraints, ComCore Company laid-off 50 employees.
sentences.chinese: 由於預算限制，康寇爾公司裁了五十位員工。

sentences.english: She wants to (cut )a coat for the old woman.
sentences.chinese: 她想爲那位老太太裁做一件外套。

sentences.english: Two suits can be cut out of this piece of material.
sentences.chinese: 這塊料子可以裁兩套衣服。

sentences.english: As well as packaging, ironing, sewing, cutting.
sentences.chinese: 以及包裝，熨燙，車縫，裁牀。

sentences.english: Do not peel off protective films when cutting.
sentences.chinese: 裁切時勿將保護膜撕開。

sentences.english: These shirts are cut on our own patterns.
sentences.chinese: 這些襯衫是按照我們自己的紙樣裁的。

sentences.english: What are you doing? —I am looking for my ruler.
sentences.chinese: 椖閽詬墒裁矗織我正在找尺子。

sentences.english: His cutting, bamboo rafting, the lake, don't like.
sentences.chinese: 自己裁的，竹筏，湖水，不喜歡。

definition: to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
to depict/to trace (a drawing)/to copy/to touch up
to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out
to dredge/to clear away obstruction/thin/sparse/scanty/distant (relation)/not close/to neglect/negligent/to present a memorial to the Emperor/commentary/annotation
to judge (i.e. to hear and pass judgment in a law court)/to hear and decide
